intro: Xylopia bokoli, commonly known as the African star anise, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to western and central Africa. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, woody stems and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by distinctive star-shaped fruits. Its fruits are used in traditional medicine and as a spice due to their aromatic properties. Xylopia bokoli thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
